description: Anthropic is an AI research company that focuses on the safety and alignment of AI systems with human values.
company_overview: Jony Ive, former Apple design chief, will join OpenAI as part of the io acquisition, taking on a major design role. The io team, including three other veteran Apple design leaders, will also join OpenAI. Peter Welinder will lead the new hardware team, and Caitlin Kalinowski will report to him.
news: This page shows how the site appeared at 10:45 AM ET, June 11, 2025. The most current version of the site as always is available at our home page. To view an earlier snapshot click here and then modify the date indicated. In a new essay called “The Gentle Singularity,’ OpenAI CEO Sam Altman shared his latest vision for how AI will change the human experience over the next 15 years. OpenAI executives have indicated that the company is focused on getting AI models to come up with new, interesting ideas about the world. In May, Google released a paper on AlphaEvolve, an AI coding agent. Another startup backed by former Google CEO Eric Schmidt, FutureHouse, claims its AI can generate novel insights. If successful, these companies could automate a key part of the scientific process, and potentially break into massive industries such as drug discovery, material science, and other fields with science at their core. In May, Anthropic launched a program to support scientific research. In January, Altman wrote about OpenAI's plans in a blog. The broader scientific community remains somewhat skeptical of AI’s ability to generate genuinely original insights. Kenneth Stanley, a former OpenAI research lead, also previously told TechCrunch that today's AI models cannot generate novel hypotheses. Stanley is now building out a team at Lila Sciences, a startup that raised $200 million to create an AI-powered laboratory. Whether OpenAI truly creates an AI model that is capable of producing novel insights remains to be seen. Still, Altman’s essay may feature something familiar — a preview of where OpenAI is likely headed next. and interesting. It may also offer a glimpse of where the company is likely to go next.

Andrej Karpathy.wikipedia_summary:
Andrej Karpathy (born 23 October 1986) is a Slovak-Canadian computer scientist who served as the director of artificial intelligence and Autopilot Vision at Tesla. He co-founded and formerly worked at OpenAI, where he specialized in deep learning and computer vision.


== Education and early life ==
Karpathy was born in Bratislava, Czechoslovakia (now Slovakia) and moved with his family to Toronto when he was 15.

Durk Kingma.wikipedia_summary: Anthropic PBC is an American artificial intelligence (AI) startup company founded in 2021. Anthropic has developed a family of large language models (LLMs) named Claude as a competitor to OpenAI's ChatGPT and Google's Gemini. According to the company, it researches and develops AI to "study their safety properties at the technological frontier" and use this research to deploy safe models for the public.

Ilya Sutskever.wikipedia_summary: Ilya Sutskever  (Hebrew: איליה סוצקבר; born 8 December 1986) is an Israeli-Canadian computer scientist who specializes in machine learning. He has made several major contributions to the field of deep learning. With Alex Krizhevsky and Geoffrey Hinton, he co-invented AlexNet, a convolutional neural network.

Sam Altman.wikipedia_summary:
Samuel Harris Altman (born April 22, 1985) is an American technology entrepreneur and investor best known as the chief executive officer of OpenAI since 2019 (he was briefly dismissed and reinstated in November 2023). He is considered one of the leading figures of the AI boom. 
Altman dropped out of Stanford University after two years and founded Loopt, a mobile social networking service, raising more than $30 million in venture capital.

Trevor Blackwell.wikipedia_summary:
Trevor Blackwell (born 4 November 1969, in Canada) is a Canadian-American computer programmer, engineer, entrepreneur and roboticist based in England.
Blackwell is a developer of humanoid robots. Blackwell is the founder and former CEO of Anybots and a partner at Y Combinator.

Wojciech Zaremba.wikipedia_summary: Wojciech Zaremba (born 30 November 1988) is a Polish computer scientist and founding team member of OpenAI (2016–present). He initially led OpenAI's work on robotics, notably creating a robotic arm capable of solving Rubik's Cube. When the team was dissolved in 2020, he began leading teams working on OpenAI's GPT models, GitHub Copilot, and Codex.
